newsArray.title: Arsenal fans revel in ‘rattling the Strictly community’ after backlash over voting to save Tony Adams
creator: Kealan Hughes
newsArray.content: ARSENAL fans have been winding up Stricly Come Dancing viewers by voting for Gunners legend Tony Adams to remain in the competition. Adams is through to week eight of the show along with dance partner Katya Jones and four other couples. PATony Adams and partner Katya were voted through to week eight on Sunday[/caption] PASome Stricly viewers feel Adams is only still in the competition because of his support from Arsenal fans[/caption] The pair danced salsa this week to a track by Pitbull but some Stricly fans felt Tony ought to be voted off. One viewer labelled Tony’s progress a “disgrace”, suggesting he only remains in the show because loyal Arsenal fans keep voting for their former captain. But Arsenal fans are loving it and find the outcry from Strictly fans hilarious. One supporter wrote: “Arsenal annoying the footballing world Arsenal annoying the Strictly world. It’s absolutely beautiful.” READ MORE ON ARSENAL GUNNERS LIVE Gunners to 'battle' Spurs for David, Martinelli and Jesus make Brazil squad DOUBLE UP Win a Range Rover SVR and a Nissan GTR or £75k cash for just 89p with Sun code Another added: “The Arsenal fanbase mobilising to keep Tony Adams in #Strictly is a highlight of the year… “The meltdown it’s causing among some hardcore fans is hilarious .” And a third said: “Not only The Arsenal rattled the Premier League and the likes of Keys, Neville and all the other haters, but we’ve managed to rattle the Strictly community too. What a club!” Another Gooner commented: “People surprised at Tony Adams going through clearly don’t know Arsenal fans. They’re organised, relentless voters and middle class. Most read in Football WILLS AND HARRY Prince William makes awkward comment to Harry Kane ahead of World Cup ALV A GO HEROES FA Cup 2nd round draw in full as non-league giantkillers get new big tie SAMBA SQUAD Brazil's World Cup squad announced, Arsenal's Gabriel & Liverpool's Firmino OUT BILL DEAL Five billionaires who could buy Liverpool and have shown interest including Musk ANFIELD AUCTION Liverpool put up for SALE as owner invites offers for club after 12 years RED REDEMPTION Liverpool get horror Champions League draw & Chelsea also facing tricky tie HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL “They’ll watch Strictly in droves and once voted for Gunnersaurus to win goal of the month. “Adams could win this.”

newsArray.title: ‘We have fun’: Kulusevski says he absolutely loves playing with £15m Tottenham player
creator: Subhankar Mondal
newsArray.description: Tottenham Hotspur winger Dejan Kulusevski has told Football.London that he loves playing with his Spurs teammate Matt Doherty. Kulusevski, on loan at Tottenham from Juventus,... The post ‘We have fun’: Kulusevski says he absolutely loves playing with £15m Tottenham player appeared first on HITC.
newsArray.content: Tottenham Hotspur winger Dejan Kulusevski has told Football.London that he loves playing with his Spurs teammate Matt Doherty. Kulusevski, on loan at Tottenham from Juventus, made the comments about Republic of Ireland international right-back Doherty after the Premier League match against Liverpool at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium at the weekend. Both Kulusevski and Doherty – who cost Tottenham £14.7 million (The Guardian) when they signed him from Wolverhampton Wanderers in 2020 – came on as substitutes in the second half in North London. Tottenham were 2-0 down to Liverpool in the first half. Egypt international forward Mohamed Salah scored both the goals for Liverpool. Harry Kane pulled one back for Tottenham after the break. Antonio Conte’s Tottenham played better in the second half and could have picked up a point from the encounter with the late chanced they had. Photo by Julian Finney/Getty Images After the match, Kulusevski, who has established himself as one of the best and most important players at Tottenham, spoke highly of Doherty and underlined why he enjoys playing with the former Wolverhampton Wanderers star, who is operating as a right-back at Spurs. Dejan Kulusevski on Tottenham Hotspur teammate Matt Doherty Kulusevski said about Doherty: “It’s very easy to play with him. Also last year I played a lot with him and he’s a fantastic player, especially going forward. “We have fun, we enjoy and we will play in the future. I’m looking forward to playing with everybody. “It’s no training. It’s just sometimes you just feel good with some players, and I feel good with everybody. “I have to watch what they are good on and Matt likes to do small passes and do small movements, so I try to give him the ball and help him on the overlap.” The post ‘We have fun’: Kulusevski says he absolutely loves playing with £15m Tottenham player appeared first on HITC.

newsArray.title: Rugby-Hodgson to join England as defence coach, Seibold returning to NRL
newsArray.description: (Reuters) - England have appointed Brett Hodgson as defence coach with the Australian set to start his new assignment following the ongoing Autumn Nations Series, the Rugby Football Union (RFU) announced on Tuesday. Read full story

newsArray.title: England women’s star Lotte Wubben-Moy will refuse to watch World Cup due to Qatar’s laws on homosexuality
creator: Metro Sport Reporter
newsArray.description: The tournament begins later this month amid a backdrop of controversy.
newsArray.content: Lotte Wubben-Moy will refuse to watch the upcoming World Cup in Qatar (Picture: Getty) England and Arsenal defender Lotte Wubben-Moy has said she will not watch the men’s World Cup because of Qatar’s laws which make homosexuality punishable by death. Wubben-Moy said she would support the England men’s team in the tournament, which begins in less than two weeks’ time, but will keep her television turned off amid the controversy surrounding Qatar’s staging of the showpiece event. ‘It’s tough,’ the 23-year-old said. “As an England team we all have strong values. And a lot of those values aren’t reflected in the way that we see it in Qatar. I think it’s a tough conversation to have and there’s a lot of dialogue around it. ‘I personally will be supporting the men’s team, but I won’t be watching. I think it’s hard to talk about. But at the end of the day, we’re one team here at England and we know that they have an opportunity to play at a World Cup. It’s hard to look beyond that really.’ Last week, FIFA reportedly wrote to participating nations urging them to ‘focus on the football’ but the Football Association joined nine other national governing bodies from across Europe in responding over the weekend by saying they would advocate for human rights. And Wubben-Moy believes it is right that sport and politics are not separated. ‘Sport is a very strong vehicle for change,” she said. “To underestimate that would be naive, I think. I’ve seen a lot of the players have strong viewpoints and I salute them and I wish them the best in looking to express that throughout this World Cup. Metro World Cup 2022 coverage World Cup 2022: Start date, schedule, teams, kick-off times and TV All the key dates and times for England World Cup 2022 matches Every World Cup 2022 home and away kit released so far When will the England World Cup 2022 squad be announced? Which Premier League players will miss the World Cup with injury? When does the Premier League stop for the World Cup 2022? Read the latest World Cup news on Metro.co.uk's dedicated page. ‘It’s a World Cup and, for a lot of these players, they might not ever play in a World Cup again, so I can’t comment on them choosing to go because many people would take that same choice as well. ‘But I think sport is very strong for change and in any way possible that they can use this opportunity to help bring about change, I think that’s important.’ Wubben-Moy’s stance chimes with that of her Arsenal and England teammate Beth Mead who last week admitted she also felt uneasy at the prospect of the tournament being held in Qatar. Speaking on BBC Radio 4, the 27-year-old said: ‘It’s not something I will be backing or promoting. ‘It’s disappointing in the sense there’s no respect on a lot of levels, even though it’s a game of football.’ Qatar, which follows strict Muslim laws, has been criticised about its stance on same-sex relationships and human rights issues.’ Mead, player of the tournament and Golden Boot winner when England won the Euros this summer, added: ‘Although I’m cheering for the boys who are going to play football there, from the minute it was announced I thought it wasn’t the best idea.’ MORE : Brazil boss Tite explains Gabriel Martinelli World Cup call-up as Arsenal fans notice Neymar reaction MORE : Arsenal star Gabriel Magalhaes reacts to missing out on World Cup after Brazil snub For more stories like this, check our sport page. Follow Metro Sport for the latest news on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

newsArray.title: 'If it's not Arsenal': Tim Sherwood drops Newcastle Premier League title claim
creator: Amir Mir
newsArray.description: Tim Sherwood backed Newcastle United to be the ‘biggest shout’ to challenge Manchester City for the Premier League title, if it’s not Arsenal. The title-winner... The post 'If it's not Arsenal': Tim Sherwood drops Newcastle Premier League title claim appeared first on HITC.
newsArray.content: Tim Sherwood backed Newcastle United to be the ‘biggest shout’ to challenge Manchester City for the Premier League title, if it’s not Arsenal. The title-winner with Blackburn Rovers pointed out that Eddie Howe’s side aren’t in Europe and the big pockets of Newcastle also have the January transfer window to play with. Heading into the 2022 World Cup in Qatar, where domestic football will take a break, Newcastle need to win their weekend game against Chelsea and they will be sitting third at Christmas. Photo by Serena Taylor/Newcastle United via Getty Images That’s some turnaround for the Magpies, who only 12 months ago, were sitting in the relegation zone and struggling to win a game of football, never mind challenge near the top. But that’s what happens when you have a change of ownership, manager and a wad of cash thrown at the squad, which has transformed the football club. Well, things can be taken a few more steps further forward during the winter transfer window, as Sherwood spoke about Newcastle’s title chances, as he told Premier League Productions (07/11/22 at 2:35 pm). “If it’s not Arsenal have we not got a title race,” asked Sherwood. “If it’s not Arsenal, who is it going to be?  “Because I think Newcastle would be the bigger shout. The reason why I say that, is not because they are in third position, of course, they are in third. “But there is no Champions League. No Europa League. They are going to strengthen. If they win this weekend, then they will be, at least third, going into Christmas. It’s an opportunity.” Photo by Chloe Knott – Danehouse/Getty Images HOW FAR SHOULD NEWCASTLE PIUSH IN JANUARY? On one hand, Arsenal have a team firing and producing the goods, from top to bottom, so how much of that do they need to disrupt? In truth, there aren’t many weak points, if any, of the team, so if anybody does come in, then they will be an initial back-up player. One area that could be improved is the bench, but once again, how much does a team need to spend during a January window to improve their bench? Either way, if the Magpies want to go crazy, then they know they can do it, but, like they have been doing, if they remain calculated, measured and calm, then perhaps it will suit them best. The post 'If it's not Arsenal': Tim Sherwood drops Newcastle Premier League title claim appeared first on HITC.

newsArray.title: Arsenal to strengthen midfield with Palmeiras’ Danilo in January, with Leicester’s Youri Tielemans still a transfer option for Mikel Arteta
creator: Jake Lambourne
newsArray.content: Arsenal are ‘close’ to signing Palmeiras midfielder Danilo, with manager Mikel Arteta keen to bolster his midfield in January. The Premier League side have been linked with the 21-year-old before following his standout displays with the Brazilian giants. GettyArsenal are said to be close to signing Palmeiras midfielder Danilo in January[/caption] It’s no secret that the north London giants are in the market for a midfielder having had three bids rejected by Aston Villa for Douglas Luiz on deadline day. And according to Bola VIP, Arsenal appear to have stepped up their efforts to snap up Danilo when the transfer window opens in the new year. The Brazilian news outlet reports that Palmeiras are willing to let the youngster go with their Copa Libertadores campaign now over. Danilo recently helped his side win the top-flight title, and he is alleged to now be on his way to England after the World Cup. It has been said how Palmeiras have identified Udinese’s Walace to be Danilo’s replacement, who is ‘close to signing’ for Arsenal. Able to operate as a No.6 and No.8, Danilo would provide competition to both Thomas Partey and Granit Xhaka. Most read in football glory When Gareth Southgate will confirm England World Cup squad and who is set to be in selected Martinelli makes Brazil squad but no room for Arsenal teammate and Liverpool man retort McClean responds to Souness comments about poppy stance on talkSPORT after more boos joy Antony dances, but Richarlison can't watch as Brazil players watch squad announcement REALITY Jordan names price FSG are likely to sell for after shock news from boardroom TOUGH Souness' blunt reaction to Man United drawing Barcelona but Xavi is gutted Danilo has been with Palmeiras since 2020 and played in their defeat to Chelsea in the Club World Cup final in FebruaryGetty The versatile player has appeared in a whopping 56 games in all competitions during the 2022 season – chipping in with seven goals and four assists. And should he link up with the Premier League table-toppers, he would be one of a number of Brazilians recruited by compatriot and Arsenal technical director Edu. Gabriel Jesus and Gabriel Martinelli, who have made Tite’s World Cup squad, are on the club’s books, along with Gabriel Magalhaes and Marquinhos. Along with Danilo, Leicester’s contract rebel Youri Tielemans remains an option for Arteta, according to Italian journalist Rudy Galetti. Arteta is looking to bolster Arsenal’s midfield in January and beyondAFP With his contract to expire next summer, the Foxes could be willing to part ways with the Belgian in a cut-price deal. Leicester boss Brendan Rodgers recently stated how he hopes Tielemans extends his stay at the King Power Stadium. He said: “Youri provides the team with a great know-how in the game. “He’s a wonderful player to work with. I’ll just continue to work and develop his game while he’s here, however long that is. “I’d love him to sign another deal and continue his journey here. We’ll see in the coming months.” OFFER OF THE DAY Bet365: Bet £10 Get £50 In Free Bets* – CLAIM HERE Open account offer. Bet £10 & Get £50 in Free Bets for new customers at bet365. newsArray.title: Bayern Munich vs Werder Bremen: 2022/23 Bundesliga full coverage
creator: Ineednoname
newsArray.content: Photo by Marco Steinbrenner/DeFodi Images via Getty Images Catch our full coverage of Bayern Munich’s Bundesliga clash vs Werder Bremen right here! As Bayern Munich gear up for the penultimate game before the World Cup, they find themselves at the top of the table. Keeping hold of that position until the very end is the goal right now, especially with Union Berlin looking like they might wobble a little. Werder Bremen have been in good form this season, so coach Ole Werner will be optimistic about his chances vs Bayern this year. Bremen basically never beat this team, but this is a weird season so anything can happen. Losing their top scorer in Niclas Fullkrug however will be a huge blow for them, and it remains to be seen whether Bremen can recover and do to Bayern what they did to BVB earlier in the campaign. Join us here on Bavarian Football Works for the full story. We have news, updates, podcasts, analysis, and a lot more besides — for this game and so many others! We never miss a match, so be sure to check it all out.

newsArray.title: Graeme Souness’ England World Cup starting XI to face Iran includes James Maddison and Harry Maguire but NO Jude Bellingham, Jack Grealish or Bukayo Saka
creator: Jake Lambourne
newsArray.content: Graeme Souness has named James Maddison and Harry Maguire in his England starting XI to face Iran at the 2022 World Cup. The Three Lions begin their quest to win the tournament in Qatar on November 21, with the Asian nation first up for Gareth Southgate‘s side. Maddison could be included in England’s World Cup squad and, if he is, Souness wants him to startGetty But Souness can’t find room for Borussia Dortmund wonderkid Jude BellinghamGetty Southgate will name his final 26-man squad for the competition on Thursday. There has been much debate at who Southgate could bring in and what big names may miss out. One of those in question is Leicester midfielder Maddison, with former England boss Glenn Hoddle telling talkSPORT he has to be on the plane. And it is a view shared by former Liverpool captain Souness who has picked him in his line-up, which surprisingly didn’t include Jude Bellingham or Bukayo Saka. Going for a 5-2-3 formation, Souness named both Kyle Walker and Reece James in his XI providing both defenders get back to full fitness soon. Running through his line-up on White and Jordan starting with the goalkeeper, Souness said: “[Jordan] Pickford. He’s the man in possession. Maguire has had a tough time lately but Souness would still start himGetty Graeme Souness believes England should play a back five at the World Cup in their opener against IrantalkSPORT Most read in football gossip Arsenal 'close' to signing young Brazilian as Arteta looks to bolster midfield glory When Gareth Southgate will confirm England World Cup squad and who is set to be in selected Martinelli makes Brazil squad but no room for Arsenal teammate and Liverpool man retort McClean responds to Souness comments about poppy stance on talkSPORT after more boos joy Antony dances, but Richarlison can't watch as Brazil players watch squad announcement REALITY Jordan names price FSG are likely to sell for after shock news from boardroom “So I’m going three [centre-halves] at the back, Kyle Walker, John Stones and Harry Maguire.” Interjecting, Simon Jordan asked if there was any room for Arsenal’s versatile defender Ben White. To which Souness joked: “Whose team is it?” As for his wing-backs, Souness remarked: “If fit, I’d have Reece James on the right and Kieran Trippier on the left.” He continued: “I’ve got James Maddison in midfield with Declan Rice and Mason Mount.” Sterling gets the nod in a three-man attackgetty But after realising he had in fact named 12 players in his team, he reluctantly dropped the Chelsea man to the bench. Joking about his mistake, he quipped: “I looked at the squad of players and thought, ‘how could England beat Iran? I know, we’ll go with 12′ and see if we can get away with it.” Commenting on his attack, he stated: “Up front, Phil Foden, Raheem Sterling and Harry [Kane].” Graeme Souness’ England XI to face Iran This is how Souness would have the Three Lions starting against Iran on November 21 OFFER OF THE DAY Bet365: Bet £10 Get £50 In Free Bets* – CLAIM HERE Open account offer. newsArray.title: FIFA World Cup 2022: All you need to know about fixtures, timings, broadcasters
newsArray.description: In less than two weeks, the FIFA World Cup 2022 will hit the ground running as 32 teams will take the center stage in Qatar. Like the players, the fans have also been waiting for the showpiece event to start as they gather for a universal celebration of football. Teams like Argentina and Brazil should be the heavy favourites to clinch the title, but other teams will also showcase their supremacy in the biggest carnival of football. Ahead of the tournament, here is an ultimate guide for the FIFA World Cup and a detailed look at the schedule and live streaming.

newsArray.title: Gabriel Martinelli joins Neymar in Brazil’s World Cup squad, but no place for Arsenal teammate Gabriel or Liverpool forward Roberto Firmino
creator: Jackson Cole
newsArray.content: Gabriel Martinelli has been included in Brazil’s World Cup squad, however, there are no places for Arsenal teammate Gabriel Magalhaes or Liverpool forward Roberto Firmino. It was initially reported that Firmino would be selected ahead of Martinelli, however, it’s been announced that manager Tite has decided to take the Gunners forward to Qatar. Martinelli has made a fine start to the season and has been rewarded with a place in Brazil’s World Cup squadGetty But there’s heartbreak for Arsenal teammate GabrielGetty As well as Liverpool star Firmino, who has started the Premier League season wellGetty Gabriel Jesus also joins Martinelli in the squad, with Manchester United quad Casemiro, Antony, Fred and Alex Telles also in. Liverpool duo Alisson and Fabinho are also included. Other Premier League players part of the 26-man squad are Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson, Tottenham forward Richarlison, West Ham midfielder Lucas Paqueta, Newcastle star Bruno Guimaraes and Chelsea defender Thiago Silva. Neymar is unsurprisingly included in the squad, while veteran defender Dani Alves also makes it. Other notable names in Tite’s squad include Real Madrid trio Vinicius Jr, Rodrygo and Eder Militao as well as Barcelona forward and former Leeds star Raphinha. Martinelli has enjoyed a fine start to the season, firing in five Premier League goals so far for table-toppers Arsenal. Many will feel his call-up his deserved, however, his progress in recent years has been nothing short of remarkable. Brazil's 2022 World Cup squad Goalkeepers: Alisson (Liverpool), Ederson (Manchester City), Weverton (Palmeiras) Defenders: Danilo (Juventus), Dani Alves (Club Universidad de Nacional), Alex Sandro (Juventus), Alex Telles (Manchester United), Thiago Silva (Chelsea), Marquinhos (Paris Saint-Germain), Eder Militao (Real Madrid), Bremer (Juventus) Midfielders: Casemiro (Manchester United), Fabinho (Liverpool), Bruno Guimaraes (Newcastle), Fred (Manchester United), Lucas Paqueta (West Ham), Everton Ribeiro (Flamengo) Forwards: Neymar (Paris Saint-Germain), Vinicius Jr (Real Madrid), Gabriel Jesus (Arsenal), Antony (Manchester United), Richarlison (Tottenham), Gabriel Martinelli (Arsenal), Raphinha (Barcelona), Rodrygo (Real Madrid), Pedro (Fluminese) Most read in Football retort McClean responds to Souness comments about poppy stance on talkSPORT after more boos joy Antony dances, but Richarlison can't watch as Brazil players watch squad announcement gossip Arsenal 'close' to signing of Brazilian as Arteta looks to bolster midfield glory When will Gareth Southgate confirm final England squad for 2022 World Cup? REALITY Jordan names price FSG are likely to sell for after shock news from boardroom TOUGH Souness' blunt reaction to Man United drawing Barcelona but Xavi is gutted new dawn? Liverpool put up for sale: Fenway Sports Group invite offers to buy club pot Champions League draw LIVE: Liverpool face Real Madrid in repeat of last season's final Neymar and co are the bookies’ favourites to win the World CupAFP When the Selecao won the Copa America in 2019, Martinelli was playing for Ituano in the Brazilian fourth tier. But it seems Martinelli’s dad was never in doubt that his son would be representing his country in Qatar. Martinelli said in June: “I am trying everything to go to the World Cup. When I was 7 my dad told me that when I am 21, there will be a World Cup and you’re going to be playing.” Watch the World Cup with talkSPORT At talkSPORT we are powered by fans, so come and join us for the ultimate World Cup fan experience this winter – at the talkSPORT Fan Zone. In a huge indoor venue under the arches at Waterloo in London, we’ll bring you live screenings of every World Cup game. There will be Q&As with talkSPORT talent, you’ll be part of our live broadcasts, and there will be plenty of food and drink on offer too. Come and enjoy the best World Cup fan experience in London – and enjoy a pint on us – with tickets for England and Wales’ group stage games on sale now HERE!

newsArray.title: Man Utd ‘inquire about Choupo-Moting as they target Bayern Munich goal machine to replace Cristiano Ronaldo in January’
creator: Kealan Hughes
newsArray.content: MANCHESTER UNITED have inquired about the availability of Bayern Munich striker Eric Choupo-Moting, according to reports. The Red Devis are believed to be in the market for a striker with Cristiano Ronaldo possibly set to leave in January. United were linked with a transfer move for Choupo-Moting last week following his impressive form in Bundesliga. And now Sky Sports Germany reporter Florian Plettenberg claims United have submitted an inquiry for the forward. But the journalist adds that the former Stoke player will stay at Bayern and the German champions will open up contract talks with the striker after the World Cup. German outlet Bild report Choupo-Moting wants to pen one last lucrative contract while he remains at his peak. United will likely continue to monitor his situation with Choupo-Moting out of contract at the end of the season. Bayern are set to open talks over a new deal as the Cameroon international has hit terrific form this season. The 33-year-old has ten goals in 14 appearances in all competitions. And his five goals in eight league games means he averages a goal every 75 minutes in league competition. HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL Manchester City star Erling Haaland is the only striker in Europe's top five leagues with a better hit rate, averaging a goal every 53 minutes - so Choupo-Moting is ahead of Harry Kane, Neymar and former team-mate Robert Lewandowski. Given Ronaldo's struggles in front of goal this campaign it is little surprise Erik ten Hag is looking for replacements. Ronaldo has started in each of United's last four games but failed to find the net and he could move on in January amid internet from Napoli .

newsArray.title: Socceroos to focus on football: Arnold
creator: Steve Larkin
newsArray.description: Socceroos coach Graham Arnold has told his players to focus on football and not Qatar's human rights record during the World Cup.

newsArray.title: Football rumours: Chelsea receive boost in pursuit of AC Milan’s Rafael Leao
newsArray.description: Chelsea have received a significant boost in their pursuit of Rafael Leao, according to the Daily Mirror. Citing Sky Sports Italy, the Mirror says there have been complications in talks between Leao and his current club AC Milan, opening the window for the London club to swoop in with a potential mammoth offer.

newsArray.title: Report: What Liverpool owners FSG truly think about Newcastle under PIF
creator: Subhankar Mondal
newsArray.description: According to The Mirror, Liverpool owners, the Fenway Sports Group, have accepted that they cannot compete with Newcastle United owners, Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund.... The post Report: What Liverpool owners FSG truly think about Newcastle under PIF appeared first on HITC.
newsArray.content: Subhankar Mondal According to The Mirror , Liverpool owners, the Fenway Sports Group, have accepted that they cannot compete with Newcastle United owners, Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund. Liverpool owners FSG wary of Newcastle owners PIF The report has claimed that John W Henry’s Fenway Sports Group (FSG) are willing to sell Liverpool for £4 billion. One of the reasons why FSG are willing to sell the former Premier League and UEFA Champions League winners now is the spending power of PIF, who own Newcastle. The Mirror have claimed that FSG have accepted that going forward, they cannot compete with PIF with their spending power. Photo by John Powell/Liverpool FC via Getty Images ‘Buy him’: Ferdinand tells Newcastle to sell Saint-Maximin and sign 29yo Newcastle have enquired about signing £52m Liverpool winger target Encouraging for the Magpies In our view, FSG’s reported view of PIF is very encouraging for Newcastle United. It shows that clubs are worried about Newcastle and what they can achieve under PIF. Newcastle have the wealthiest owners in club football right now, and the sky is the limit for them. Now, of course, there are Financial Fair Play rules that Newcastle have to follow, but there is no reason why they cannot become like Manchester City or Paris Saint-Germain in the next five to 10 years, especially if they achieve success on the pitch like they are doing right now. In other news, Tim Sherwood claims Conte 'doesn't allow' media to ask one question after Tottenham defeat

newsArray.title: 22-year-old powerhouse could be a monstrous signing for Ten Hag's Manchester United in 2023
creator: Dan Coombs
newsArray.description: Manchester United are paying attention to the situation of Dusan Vlahovic at Juventus,  The Telegraph report. Juventus were as low as eighth in Serie A midway through the weekend and United are monitoring Vlahovic in case he becomes available next summer if his side fail to qualify for European football. United were reported to be ... The post 22-year-old powerhouse could be a monstrous signing for Ten Hag's Manchester United in 2023 appeared first on United In Focus.
newsArray.content: By Dan Coombs Manchester United are paying attention to the situation of Dusan Vlahovic at Juventus, The Telegraph report. Juventus were as low as eighth in Serie A midway through the weekend and United are monitoring Vlahovic in case he becomes available next summer if his side fail to qualify for European football. United were reported to be monitoring Vlahovic 12 months ago, The Mail reported. He was also a player the paper reported that Ralf Rangnick recommended to Manchester United last January. The club refused to sanction any incoming deals last January with an interim boss in charge – now United could get a second chance. There is good reason for United to be paying serious attention to Dusan Vlahovic, he’s a tremendous prospect who could be phenomenal under Erik ten Hag. Vlahovic is a powerhouse of a striker who embarrassed Axel Tuanzebe in the Coppa Italia last season, and has scored consistently whichever club he is at. He scored 21 goals for Fiorentina in 2020/21, and then struck 20 before moving to Juventus mid-season. This calendar year he has scored 16 times for his new club. This season he can boast six in 10 Serie A games. Vlahovic got the better of Cristiano Ronaldo in World Cup qualifiers between Serbia and Portugal, he has eight goals in 16 games for his country. At only 22-years-old, Vlahovic is an excellent prospect, a creditable alternative to Erling Haaland, who United could build their attack around. Erik ten Hag showed at Ajax that he likes his strikers to have a physical presence, with both Sebastien Haller and Brian Brobbey leading the line. Vlahovic has the same strength to his game, and a ruthless edge in front of goal. Juventus teammate Filip Kostic told Calciomercato earlier this summer, “He is the strongest striker in the league. I’m fortunate to be able to play alongside him.” United’s next move up front is a crucial one, with Cristiano Ronaldo 37 and out of contract next year, and injury prone Anthony Martial unreliable. Vlahovic is a player who really shouldn’t be available if Juventus are doing well. But if they continue to struggle, and United can pull off a swoop, then he would be a monstrous signing in this Red Devils team, surrounding pace and trickery in forward areas.

newsArray.title: Arsenal news LIVE: Arteta ‘wants’ Tielemans, Gunners to ‘battle’ Spurs for David, Martinelli and Jesus make Brazil squad
creator: Kealan Hughes
newsArray.content: ARSENAL boss Mikel Arteta has reportedly revived his interest in Belgian ace Youri Tielemans. The Leicester ace was heavily linked with a move last summer and now, reports claim that Arteta wants the chiefs to sign Tielemans in January. It has also been suggested that Arsenal want to sign Lille striker Jonathan David but they face a fight against bitter rivals Tottenham for his services. And the Gunners' attacking duo Gabriel Martinelli and Gabriel Jesus have both been called up to the Brazilian national squad for the World Cup. But their defensive teammate Gabriel Magalhaes will sit this one out with Tite opting to go with a more experienced back-line instead. HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL Follow ALL of the latest updates below... Two Gunners stars have been given the nod for Brazil’s World Cup squad. But there was heartache as a third Emirates Samba star was brutally axed. Gabriel Jesus and Gabriel Martinelli are both on their way to Qatar 2022 this month. However, Gabriel Magalhaes misses out despite being a rock at the back this season. Meanwhile, Oleksandr Zinchenko admits everyone at Arsenal is dreaming of a first title since the Invincibles in 2004. He said: “There is always some space to improve but we are in the right way as a team, as a family. “It starts in the dressing room and it’s on the pitch as well. “We are trying to push each other, we are trying to help each other. This is the right way to do it. “Still we have a dream, we believe that we can achieve something this season.” Finally, Arsenal fans had little time for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang at the weekend. That’s after singing a very rude song at their former captain. The now-Chelsea striker had a day to forget as his side suffered a 1-0 defeat at Stamford Bridge. And after Auba’s fight with Mikel Arteta last year, Arsenal fans yelled: “Mikel Arteta, he thinks that you’re sh*t!” Arsenal are keen on signing Lille star Jonathan David. But they face a fight against rivals Spurs for the striker. GiveMeSport claims the duo are eager to bring David to England. But any interested parties must bid £40million before opening talks with the player. Mikel Arteta has reportedly told Arsenal chiefs to sign Youri Tielemans in January. The Leicester star is out of contract next summer. And Arteta believes he can play a key role for Arsenal in their bid for top spot. But it's reckoned another English club are also in for Tielemans, as well as two Italians sides. Oleksandr Zinchenko admits everyone at Arsenal is dreaming of a first title since the Invincibles in 2004. He said: “There is always some space to improve but we are in the right way as a team, as a family. “It starts in the dressing room and it’s on the pitch as well. “We are trying to push each other, we are trying to help each other. This is the right way to do it. “Still we have a dream, we believe that we can achieve something this season.” Emmanuel Petit has warned Arsenal they will finish second to Man City in the title race. He told Lord Ping : “Chelsea need a reaction, they have to get points if they want to finish in the top four. “The competition will be fierce and Chelsea are far away. It doesn’t matter how they win points, they just need to win. “For me, Man City will win the Premier League title, Arsenal will finish second, Liverpool will finish third and I think Newcastle will beat Tottenham, Chelsea and Man United to the fourth spot.” Arsenal need to UPGRADE on Gabriel Jesus as he’s not a match winner - according to ex-Gooner Emmanuel Petit. He told Lord Ping : “ I’ve been very pleased with the way that Arsenal have been playing since the beginning of the season. “They deserved to win against Chelsea but I still believe there's a gap between them and Man City because of two things; the depth of the squad, you can't compare the quality of the bench between either side. “Secondly, Man City signed Erling Haaland to fill a void and if you compare him with Gabriel Jesus, I really like Jesus but he's not a match-winner and Haaland is. “You can see that when he came off the bench against Fulham, he made a big difference in the game and that's the difference. “No one knows what Arsenal are going to do in the next transfer window, but they need to add quality players to the squad.” Arsenal fans had little time for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang at the weekend. That's by singing a very rude song at their former captain. The now-Chelsea striker had a day to forget as his side suffered a 1-0 defeat at Stamford Bridge. And after Auba's fight with Mikel Arteta last year, Arsenal fans yelled: "Mikel Arteta, he thinks that you’re sh*t!" Man Utd legend Gary Neville insists he still has doubts over Arsenal’s title credentials. He said: "We have to question them… because they haven't proven it yet. It's like a boxer that hasn't won a world title, or a national title. "We've seen over the last few years - this Arsenal group of players have found it more difficult in the last part of season. “It's not overly negative. Let's see what happens in 20 games' time.” Gabriel Magalhas has been axed from Brazil’s squad for Qatar 2022. But teammate Gabriel Martinelli and Gabriel Jesus have been summoned for this month’s tournament. Elsewhere, Liverpool’s Roberto Firmino has also been left out. But numerous other Prem stars like Man Utd’s Casemiro and Chelsea’s Thiago Silva have made the cut. SEE BRAZIL’S WORLD CUP SQUAD HERE Emmanuel Petit reckons William Saliba can be Arsenal's John Terry in their title charge. He told Lord Ping : "William Saliba is amazing. He has all the qualities to do the same as John Terry. "He's very mature, came back to Arsenal with a lot of motivation and he's improved a lot as a human being as well as a footballer. "Saliba was a rock against Chelsea, I wouldn't like to be a striker playing against him because he's tough and his confidence is really entering his game." Arsenal will hold a warm weather camp in Dubai next month. The Athletic claims Mikel Arteta will whisk stars away to the Middle East next month after going top of the Premier League. Several players will not be featuring at the World Cup. And Arsenal will also organise several friendlies to keep fitness levels going. Former Arsenal goalie Petr Cech has signed for ice hockey side Chelmsford Chieftains. He left Guildford Phoenix earlier this year after three years with the Surrey outfit. Cech has joined the Chieftains on a one-year deal and his signing was announced ahead of the game against Oxford City Stars on Sunday. Arsenal take on Brighton in the Carabao Cup this week. The Gunners would love to bolster their title credentials with victory in the season's first cup competition. But what TV channel is the match on? And what's the latest team news? SEE ARSENAL TV INFO HERE Ex-Arsenal wonderkid Omari Hutchinson could be set for his Chelsea debut on Wednesday after being told not to report for international duty with Jamaica. The 19-year-old forward is very highly rated and has even been compared to Raheem Sterling. He hit the headlines last month after scoring a brilliant solo goal to help the Under-21s beat Leyton Orient 3-2. Now Chelsea supporters could get a chance to see him in first-team action in the Carabao Cup clash with Manchester City on November 9. Arsenal could sit back and relax as Man Utd drew a nightmare tie against Barcelona in the Europa League round of 32 play-off. Based on this draw Arsenal would have played against Sevilla due to PSV - the runners-up in the Gunners group - drawing them. You can see the full draw below. Arsenal stars Gabriel Martinelli and Gabriel Magalhaes are set to miss the cut for Brazil's World Cup squad. Journalist has reported Bruno Andrade has reported the full list of names who will be involved, and missed out the two Arsenal stars. However, Arsenal ace Gabriel Jesus has reportedly made the cut. See full list below Arsenal's rivals have been waiting to find out who they will face the in Champions League round of 16, and there have been some tasty ties cooked up. Here are who the English teams have been drawn against: RB Leipzig v Man City Liverpool v Real Madrid AC Milan v Tottenham Borussia Dortmund v Chelsea Other draws: Club Brugge v Benfica Frankfurt v Napoli Inter Milan v FC Porto PSG v Bayern Munich Full draw here Gary Neville has admitted that he would have played for arch-rivals Arsenal if Manchester United decided to sell him. The former defender, 47, spent his entire career at Old Trafford after coming through the academy as part of the Class of ’92 before making 602 first-team appearances. Speaking to Sky Sports’ Off Script, the pundit revealed there were four teams he willingly could have joined should he have been let go – and three he would never, ever have signed for. He said: I’d made the decision quite early in my 30s that if Sir Alex had come and told me my time was up, I wouldn’t have played for anyone else. I was fortunate in that sense. “However, if he’d (Sir Alex Ferguson) come to me at say the age of 28, and told me my time was up, of course I would have played for another Premier League club. “Who would I have played for? You can rule out three: I’d have never have played for [Man] City, Liverpool or Leeds. Not in a million years. “If you’d said to me, in a perfect world, in my years of playing, which clubs in the Premier League have the tradition, a proper club? Arsenal would be No 1. “The tradition of Highbury, I felt they did things the right way. Also in the Premier League, I like Aston Villa and Newcastle. “In Europe I admired Juventus and Bayern Munich. I respected them as football clubs. Bayern were meticulous in their preparation, so internationally, it would be them.” Tottenham are rivalling Arsenal in the transfer chase for Canada forward Jonathan David. According to GiveMeSport , David is in line for a move away from Ligue 1 outfit Lille having been linked to the likes of Everton and Manchester United on top of the North London pair. But any fee for him will see the buying club need to cough up at least £40million. Arsenal will find who their rivals will face in the Europa League last-16 later today. The Gunners progressed through their group with flying colours to avoid the dreaded round of 32 play-off against the third-place teams from the Champions League. And now they will find out the fate of their rivals when the draw kicks off at 12pm. You will be able to follow the draw live on SunSport here . Arsenal's draw for the round of 16 does not take place until late February. However, this will come after the Champions League draw commences an hour earlier. Match-winner Gabriel brutally trolled former captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang after Arsenal's 1-0 win against Chelsea. Prior to his reunion against Arsenal Aubameyang had declared : "Arsenal, nothing personal. I’m back. I’m blue. I’m ready. Let's go." But after celebrating his goal right in front of his former team-mate, Gabriel wrote on Twitter: "NOTHING PERSONAL .. LONDON IS RED." Gabriel Magalhaes is set to suffer World Cup heartbreak for Brazil after a number of reports in his homeland claimed that the uncapped Arsenal star will be left disappointed. Samba Boys boss Tite is due to name his selection for the tournament later today. But Gabriel is “practically out of the equation” and will not be part of Brazil’s 26-man World Cup squad, according to journalist @brunoandrd. The news will come as a bitter blow for Gabriel, who has been capped at U20 and U23 level for his nation and is in great form for his club. Arsenal fans revelled in Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's misery after the striker had a shocker against the Gunners. The former Arsenal captain turned Chelsea star managed just EIGHT touches of the ball before he was hooked in Sunday's 1-0 defeat to Mikel Arteta's side. Aubameyang was then spotted sitting on the bench looking miserable. And Arsenal fans were quick to throw the comment back in Aubameyang's face following the full-time whistle. One wrote on Twitter: "@Auba it's football, nothing personal..." Another said: "Nothing personal. Still top of the league!" And a third chimed: "Nothing personal indeed @Auba." Arsenal are set to announce the dates for a pair of friendly games they will play during the World Cup. With a big gap between competitive fixtures due to the World Cup, Arsenal have been making plans to fill the void with productive means. And according to The Athletic's David Ornstein, they are set to announce friendlies against Lyon and AC Milan. The report indicates the game against Lyon will take place on December 8 while the Milan match will occur five days later. Mikel Arteta and his remaining stars will travel to Dubai for a warm-weather training camp on December 4. Arsenal remain interested in Shakhtar Donetsk winger Mykhaylo Mudryk, according to Fabrizio Romano. In his column for CaughtOffside, Romano said: “For sure Arsenal remain interested, they are following him for a long time but there’s still nothing decided.” “Shakhtar Donetsk want more than €60-65million (£53m-57m) to sell him now and it’s not easy. The race is open, if Arsenal really want him they have to move fast.”

newsArray.title: Kalvin Phillips tells Gareth Southgate he is FULLY FIT and ready for World Cup with Man City star to return vs Chelsea
creator: Will Pugh
newsArray.content: KALVIN PHILLIPS told Gareth Southgate he is fully fit and desperate to make England’s World Cup squad. The Manchester City midfielder says his shoulder is “perfectly fine” and he is ready to play 90 minutes after nearly two months out. GettyKalvin Phillips is fit and hopes to make the England World Cup squad[/caption] Phillips had shoulder surgery in September which made him a doubt for this month’s Fifa showpiece in Qatar. But the 26-year-old is “very hopeful” of making the Three Lions’ plane with City boss Pep Guardiola assuring Phillips he will be on the bench for Wednesday’s League Cup clash with Chelsea at the Etihad. The 23-cap ace said: “The shoulder’s perfectly fine now. “I have gone through a seven-week process of recovering as fast as I possibly can for the World Cup. Everything is going great. READ MORE ON THE WORLD CUP REECE AGAINST TIME Reece James set to hand Southgate huge World Cup selection dilemma “I’ve obviously not done it for quite a long time but I’ve kept my fitness up and I could play 90 minutes.” Asked whether he is confident of making Southgate’s 26-man squad, which is revealed Thursday, Phillips said: “I’m not too sure. I’m very hopeful I can be involved.” Phillips has been restricted to three sub appearances for City since his £42million summer move from Leeds. He last played against Borussia Dortmund in the Champions League on September 14. Most read in Football ALV A GO HEROES FA Cup 2nd round draw in full as non-league giantkillers get new big tie DEL BOY Martin O'Neill reveals John Delaney's reaction to wanting Roy Keane as assistant 'I CAN'T' Man Utd fans in panic as they'll be without banned key player versus Barcelona SAMBA SQUAD Brazil's World Cup squad announced, Arsenal's Gabriel & Liverpool's Firmino OUT IN THE DOCK Mendy tells rape trial 'I'm no Brad Pitt' but it was 'easy' to sleep with women ANFIELD AUCTION Liverpool put up for SALE as owner invites offers for club after 12 years HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL And Wednesday’s Etihad clash and Sunday’s home Prem game against Brentford are his last chances for minutes before the Three Lions depart for the Middle East. Phillips added to 5Live: “Pep has been great and spoken to me quite a lot. “After my surgery, I spoke to Gareth. I said I understood if he didn’t select me but he reassured me that ‘as long as you’re fit enough and prove you’re progressing well, there’s always a chance you will be called up’. “I’ve done everything in my power to be as fit as possible and hopefully I will be involved.”

newsArray.title: FA Cup second-round draw conducted [Full fixtures]
creator: Ifreke Inyang
newsArray.description: The draw for the FA Cup second round of the 2022/2023 season has been completed. Clubs from League One and League Two were in action alongside those from outside the English Football League who have made it through the qualifying rounds of the world’s oldest tournament, with 19 Non-League sides progressing. The second-round ties are […] FA Cup second-round draw conducted [Full fixtures]
newsArray.content: Daily Post Nigeria FA Cup second-round draw conducted [Full fixtures] Home News Politics Metro Entertainment Sport Sport FA Cup second-round draw conducted [Full fixtures] Published on November 8, 2022 By Ifreke Inyang The draw for the FA Cup second round of the 2022/2023 season has been completed. Clubs from League One and League Two were in action alongside those from outside the English Football League who have made it through the qualifying rounds of the world’s oldest tournament, with 19 Non-League sides progressing. The second-round ties are not complete yet, as seven first-round replays will take place next week. Second-round fixtures will be played on the weekend of November 26, before clubs from the Premier League and Championship enter the competition for the third-round games in early January. Second-round draw: Curzon Ashton or Cambridge United vs Grimsby Town Wrexham AFC vs Farnborough Accrington Stanley vs Barnet or Chelmsford City Ebbsfleet United vs Fleetwood Town Ipswich Town vs Buxton Barnsley vs Crewe Alexandra Forest Green Rovers vs Alvechurch Portsmouth vs Milton Keynes Dons Shrewsbury Town vs Peterborough United or Salford City Solihull Moors or Hartlepool United vs Harrogate Town King’s Lynn Town vs Stevenage Charlton Athletic vs Stockport County Bristol Rovers vs Boreham Wood Dagenham & Redbridge vs AFC Fylde or Gillingham Woking or Oxford United vs Exeter City Sheffield Wednesday vs Mansfield Town Weymouth or AFC Wimbledon vs Chesterfield Burton Albion vs Chippenham Town Walsall vs Carlisle United AFC Newport County AFC vs Torquay United or Derby County FA Cup dates Second round : Saturday 26 November 2022 Third round: Saturday 7 January 2023 Fourth round: Saturday 28 January 2023 Fifth round: Wednesday 1 March 2023 Quarter-final: Saturday 18 March 2023 Semi-final: Saturday 22 April 2023 Final: Saturday 3 June 2023 Related Topics: fa cup Don't Miss LaLiga: Barcelona now top of table after Real Madrid lose at Rayo Vallecano You may like EPL: Liverpool’s Henderson sends message to Chelsea star after FA Cup penalty miss FA Cup: It was a great shame – UK Prime Minister, Boris Johnson hits back at Klopp FA Cup: You’re a fantastic player – Chelsea legend, John Terry hails Liverpool star FA Cup: Unfortunately I wasn’t right – Tuchel laments after shootout defeat to Liverpool FA Cup: Why I played winning penalty for Liverpool against Chelsea – Tsimikas FA Cup: I missed penalty but who cares – Mane hails Liverpool star for saving him Advertise About Us Contact Us Privacy-Policy Terms Copyright © Daily Post Media Ltd

newsArray.title: 'I’ve been told': Int'l manager delivers huge World Cup update on £20m Arsenal star
creator: Dylan Walsh
newsArray.description: Japan manager Hajime Moriyasu has said that Takehiro Tomiyasu is expected to be fit for the 2022 FIFA World Cup later this month in what... The post 'I’ve been told': Int'l manager delivers huge World Cup update on £20m Arsenal star appeared first on HITC.
newsArray.content: Japan manager Hajime Moriyasu has said that Takehiro Tomiyasu is expected to be fit for the 2022 FIFA World Cup later this month in what is an encouraging injury update for the Arsenal defender. Speaking to the press via Football London during a press conference to confirm Japan’s squad for Qatar, the 54-year-old coach announced that Tomiyasu will recover in time to feature for the Asian powerhouses at the World Cup, with Tomiyasu expected to miss Arsenal’s last two games before the winter break. The 23-year-old fullback came off last week in Arsenal’s 1-0 win against FC Zurich in the UEFA Europa League after feeling something shortly after coming on as a substitute. However, Tomiyasu is on course to be fit for Japan for the World Cup following this latest injury update from Moriyasu. The Japan manager said when asked about Tomiyasu’s latest fitness concerns ahead of the World Cup: “I’ve been told that he can return to work before the start of the World Cup, that he will recover without giving up & face it in good condition.” Photo by Julian Finney/Getty Images Signed from Bologna last year for nearly £20m, Tomiyasu has been one of Arsenal’s most important players over the last 12 months with the Japanese international thriving at both right-back and left-back for the Gunners, with the defender proving to be one of Mikel Arteta’s most versatile players in the entire squad. Whilst injury problems have been a concern for the 23-year-old, Tomiyasu’s performances have made the defender a favourite at the Emirates Stadium. And for Japan, having the former Serie A star fully fit for the World Cup is a huge boost for the Samuari’s bid to make history out on Qatar. Tomiyasu injury update is massive for Japan and Arsenal Photo by Koji Watanabe/Getty Images Japan head to Qatar as one of the underdogs of the competition, with Moriyasu’s side hopeful of a World Cup-best finish with arguably one of their strongest sides in recent memory. And Tomiyasu being fit for the competition is huge for the Asian nation and Arsenal. After all, Tomiyasu is expected to be a regular for a Japan side looking to progress past the group stages, and for the Gunners, the defender having a strong and healthy competition will be ideal as Arsenal look to have all their players match fit ahead of the Boxing Day Premier League return against West Ham. The post 'I’ve been told': Int'l manager delivers huge World Cup update on £20m Arsenal star appeared first on HITC.

newsArray.title: Watch Real Madrid star Valverde’s wild strike land in someone’s BALCONY as Los Blancos suffer first loss of the season
creator: Kealan Hughes
newsArray.content: REAL MADRID star Federico Valverde gifted fans a free match ball when he fired a shot into a balcony overlooking Rayo Vallecano's ground. The midfielder has scored some spectacular goals this season and tried to add another wondergoal to his showreel at the Estadio de Vallecas. A Real Madrid corner was flicked on and began to bounce away from goal when Valverde unleashed a wicked strike on the run. But he put way too much power into his out-of-control effort and the ball looped miles over the bar. And since there is only a block of flats behind the goal rather than a stand, the ball ended up on a fans' balcony, sparking huge cheers and laughter from the home fans. The three spectators watching on got a bit of a surprise and one supporter could be seen holding the ball. But rather than try to return to ball to the ground the group of fans decided to keep it as a memento. Valverde's 90th-minute strike summed up Real's performance as Carlo Ancelotti's side suffered their first league defeat of the season. Los Blancos responded to an early Vallecano opener to lead 2-1 but were pegged back on the stroke of half-time. Oscar Trejo put his side 3-2 up midway through the second half and left Real looking for a moment of magic from one of their star players. HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL But Valverde, who has scored eight goals this season including an incredible solo effort from his own half , could not provide the goal his team needed. The result means Real lose ground in the title race to rivals Barcelona , who now lead LaLiga with a two-point advantage.

newsArray.title: Cancer stricken boxing legend's devastating update
creator: wwos
newsArray.description: F﻿ormer IBF and IBO super featherweight champion Billy Dib is preparing for the most important fight of his life.
newsArray.content: A﻿ustralian boxing legend Billy Dib has opened up on his ongoing cancer battle, calling it "the hardest opponent I've faced". Dib had surgery to remove a tumor in his stomach last month , but revealed that he's now been diagnosed with an aggressive and rare form of non-Hodgkins lymphoma cancer. ﻿The former IBF and IBO super featherweight champion posted to social media on Tuesday afternoon to give his fans an update, saying the results from his surgery was "not what I was hoping for". READ MORE: 'Broken-hearted' teen star's Broncos accusation READ MORE: Hawks try to buy way out of racism claims READ MORE: Cricket legend's brutal admission after World Cup debacle READ MORE: Record ten red cards dished out in football chaos "I've had to dig deep many times in life before and with the grace of Allah (God), have got through the many struggles before me in the past," he wrote in an Instagram post . "﻿Cancer will be the hardest opponent I've faced but I want you to know that I'm fighting harder than I ever have and God willing, I will defeat this awful disease." The 37-year-old Kogarah native said the plan was to begin chemotherapy "as soon as possible". "While I know it's going to be rough, I have to walk this journey as so many others do every single day with the support of their health professionals, family and friends. "In difficult times, I know I'm not alone. I have Allah, my wife, son, family﻿ and all of you beside me. Your prayers, kind words and support all help me when I need inspiration. "I know you will understand that I will be less active on social media to focus on this challenge ahead of me but please know that your messages of support do not go unnoticed or unappreciated. "I promise to give this newest challenge everything I have, with my beautiful family, I have too much to live for to give any less than 100 (per cent)."﻿ Dib held the IBF featherweight title from 2011 to 2013, and the IBO super-featherweight title in 2008. He has won 48 out of his 56 professional fights, with 27 of those wins coming via KO.﻿ For a daily dose of the best of the breaking news and exclusive content from Wide World of Sports, subscribe to our newsletter by clicking here !

newsArray.title: American Football: Früherer NFL-Profi Edebali: Football-Hype vervielfacht sich
newsArray.description: Das Gastspiel der NFL in München sorgt für Aufsehen. Deutsche Footballer glauben an einen nachhaltigen Effekt.
newsArray.content: Das Gastspiel der NFL in München sorgt für Aufsehen. Deutsche Footballer glauben an einen nachhaltigen Effekt.Das NFL-Spiel in München wird die Sportart American Football nach Meinung des ehemaligen Profis Kasim Edebali in Deutschland "auf ein neues Level" heben."Seattle Seahawks gegen Tampa Bay Buccaneers mit Tom Brady ist ein Kracher. Der vervielfacht den Football-Hype in Deutschland über Generationen hinweg", sagte der 33 Jahre alte Hamburger der Deutschen Presse-Agentur. "Du hast Kinder, die erstmals ein NFL-Spiel sehen. Jugendliche, die motiviert werden, den Sport auszuüben und Ältere, die noch mehr Fan werden."München ist am Sonntag Gastgeber der ersten NFL-Partie in Deutschland und teilt sich mit Frankfurt in den nächsten vier Jahren vier Hauptrunden-Spiele der besten Football-Liga der Welt. "Ich würde mich freuen, wenn wir künftig noch viel mehr Spiele in Deutschland haben. Die NFL-Community bei uns ist mittlerweile riesig", sagte Edebali, dessen erstes Buch "Dream Chaser" an diesem Dienstag in den Handel kommt.Internationalisierung das große ZielDass es künftig sogar eine NFL-Division mit europäischen Teams geben könnte, glaubt Edebali nicht. "Klar ist die Internationalisierung das große Ziel der NFL, und die merken auch, was hier in Europa und speziell in Deutschland los ist. Aber die Reisestrapazen wären enorm", befand der Buch-Autor und TV-Experte.Edebali hatte vor acht Jahren den Sprung in die amerikanische National Football League geschafft und stand unter anderem bei den New Orleans Saints, Denver Broncos, Detroit Lions und Cincinnati Bengals unter Vertrag. Vor seinem Karriereende im September war der Verteidiger in seiner Hamburger Heimat für die Sea Devils aktiv."Sieg der deutschen Football-Community"Für Profi Jakob Johnson ist das erste NFL-Spiel in Deutschland ein Verdienst aller in der deutschen Football-Szene. "Das ist das Zeichen, dass die NFL den deutschen Football-Fan ernst nimmt. So eine Multi-Milliarden-Firma wie die NFL macht so was nicht einfach mal so und nicht unbedacht", sagte der Stuttgarter in Diensten der Las Vegas Raiders der Deutschen Presse-Agentur. "Die stellen nicht mal einfach so ein Spiel, das die Teams viel lieber bei sich zu Hause spielen würden, fürs Ausland zur Verfügung. Da mussten viele Weichen für gestellt werden, dass das stattfinden kann."Die enorme Summe an NFL-Abos, die Zuschauerzahlen für die Spiele im Free-TV und die Begeisterung von Ex-Profi Björn Werner und Experte Patrick Esume, die als Moderatoren viel Grundlagenarbeit geleistet hätten, sowie die deutschen Spieler im internationalen Talente-Programm der NFL hätten alle "einen kleinen Teil dazu beigetragen", sagte Johnson: "Und am Ende des Tages ist es ein Sieg der deutschen Football-Community."

newsArray.title: Früherer NFL-Profi Edebali: Football-Hype vervielfacht sich
newsArray.description: München - Das Gastspiel der NFL in München sorgt für Aufsehen. Deutsche Footballer glauben an einen nachhaltigen Effekt.
